entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 6:29AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING ACROSS THE NORTHEAST GEORGIA MOUNTAIN VALLEYS... Some patchy dense fog will restrict visibilities to less than one-half of a mile across the mountain valleys of northeast Georgia. Be prepared for rapid changes in visibility. The fog should lift after 9AM.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Fannin; Gilmer; Towns; Union

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:23AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog will affect the morning commute. Be alert for rapid changes in visibility in short distances, to below a quarter mile or less in some spots. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance between your vehicle and the one ahead of you when encountering areas of fog.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Boyd; Carter; Greenup; Lawrence

entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves of 6 to 10 feet, and occasionally higher.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Croix

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued September 11 at 4:15AM AST until September 11 at 5:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heat indices values of 108 to 111 degrees Fahrenheit. * WHERE...The urban and low lying areas along the northern coast from north central to San Juan and vicinity,Vieques, Culebra, and St. Croix.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Croix

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 11 at 3:21AM CDT until September 11 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Douglas

entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Northern Aitkin, South Aitkin, Carlton and South St. Louis and Pine Counties. entry.cap:areaDesc: Ashland; Bayfield; Douglas; Iron

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 8:39AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog will limit visibilities to a quarter of a mile or less in some areas this morning, especially in the river valleys. Use caution if traveling, and be prepared for rapid changes in visibility. Conditions should improve after 9 AM as the fog begins to dissipate.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Brooke; Hancock; Marshall; Ohio; Wetzel

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:23AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog will affect the morning commute. Be alert for rapid changes in visibility in short distances, to below a quarter mile or less in some spots. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance between your vehicle and the one ahead of you when encountering areas of fog.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:38AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Patchy dense fog can be expected this morning. Motorists should expect rapidly changing visibility, below 1/2 miles at times.
